intro: Pityrodia myriantha, commonly known as the clustered mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, white or pale blue flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine, silky hairs. Pityrodia myriantha is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
